qas.question: What development has made it unnecessary for MLB teams to play exhibition games with teams from other leagues?

What league are the Montreal Expos in?

plausible_answers.text: exhibition games during the year against nearby teams in the other major league

plausible_answers.text: the Toronto Blue Jays of the American League and the Montreal Expos of the National League,

qas.question: Which Canadian teams played in the Mayor's Trophy Game

context: Several MLB teams used to play regular <b5_0>exhibition games during the year against nearby teams in the other major league<b5_0/>, but <a0_0>regular-season interleague play<a0_0/> has made such games unnecessary. The two Canadian MLB teams, <b7_0>the Toronto Blue Jays of the <a1_0>American League<a1_0/> and the <b6_0>Montreal Expos<b6_0/> of the <a2_0>National League<a2_0/>,<b7_0/> met annually to play <a3_0>the Pearson Cup<a3_0/> exhibition game; this tradition ended when the Expos moved to Washington DC for the 2005 season. Similarly, the <b8_0>New York Yankees<b8_0/> played in the Mayor's Trophy Game against various local rivals from 1946 to <a4_0>1983<a4_0/>.
